Other Information.Test Conditions: 298 K, up to 3.6 bar partial pressure of CO2
Other Information.Additional Info: CO2 induces structural expansion to form a templated clathrate.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 298 K, up to 7.2 bar total pressure (50:50 CO2:CH4 mixture)
Other Information.Additional Info: CH4 is excluded due to pore size in CO2-expanded phase.

Sieving Mechanism: Reversible CO2 templating leading to near-perfect CO2 selectivity.

Experimental Validation.Method: Multicomponent equilibrium adsorption experiments, in situ powder X-ray diffraction
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Near-perfect CO2/CH4 selectivity under 50:50 gas mixture at 6.7, 13.9, and 25.3 bar; Selectivity of 61 ± 4 under CH4-rich conditions (6:94 CO2:CH4 ratio).

Other Information.Additional Info: The material shows flexibility and undergoes reversible structural changes upon CO2 adsorption. The first CO2-induced phase transition occurs at ~2 bar, enabling selective CO2 uptake while excluding CH4.
